comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Feb 19, 1913 NYT query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=980DE1D71E3AE633A... describes Francisco J Peynado (note different spelling) as Minister to Washington from Santo Domingo. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Ambassadors_from_the_Domini... lists Peynado as ambassador from the Dominican Republic for 1912-13. So the correct spelling is probably "Peynado".

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: The U. S. State Department lists Sr. Dr. Don Francisco J. Peynado, E.E. and M.P. for the Dominican Republic from February 23, 1912 to 1914 [ ref. www.state.gov/s/cpr/91605.htm ]

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks for the great research swanq and lifeasdaddy.  We'll correct the spelling of his name, and add a better estimate of the date when we update the record.

comment.author: 35810279@N07
comment._content: The correct spelling is Francisco J Peynado

comment._content: The individual with the megaphone is a herald.

comment._content: Jonboy270:  Thanks for the information about the man with the megaphone.  We will add it to the description when we update.
